brief:
Subtract x, y, and z components from a vector, one vector from
           another, or two independent vectors
name: sub()
description:
Subtracts x, y, and z components from a vector, subtracts one vector from
 another, or subtracts two independent vectors. The version of the method that
 substracts two vectors is a static method and returns a PVector, the others
 act directly on the vector. See the examples for more context. In all cases,
 the second vector (v2) is subtracted from the first (v1), resulting in v1-v2.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: the x component of the vector

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: the y component of the vector

parameters.name: z
parameters.description: the z component of the vector

parameters.name: v1
parameters.description: the x, y, and z components of a PVector object

parameters.name: v2
parameters.description: the x, y, and z components of a PVector object

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: PVector in which to store the result
